definition: a long period of separation
(long) time/(long) duration of time
surname Bie
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc
to meet again after a long period of separation

sentences.english: Another proverb about love is, "Absence makes the heart grow fonder."
sentences.chinese: 另一个关于爱情的谚语是，“久别情更浓。”

sentences.english: Then they had a little celebration on finding each other.
sentences.chinese: 于是，他们先庆祝了一下久别重逢。

sentences.english: People feel especially drawn to one another when they have been reunited after many years of separation.
Having reunited after a long departure, the two certainly have a lot to talk about.
sentences.chinese: 两人久别重逢，自有许多话说。

sentences.english: Refers to the long-awaited family and friends or brothers?
sentences.chinese: 指亲友或兄弟久别重逢，在一起亲切交谈。

sentences.english: Reveal between the lines forward to the long-awaited home deep memory.
sentences.chinese: 字里行间流露着对久别故乡的深怀念。

sentences.english: They were pleased to meet after such a long separation.
sentences.chinese: 久别重逢，他们非常高兴。

sentences.english: It was of course a delight for them to meet again after such a long separation.
The reunited lovers rush to a motel.
sentences.chinese: 两个久别重逢的爱人去了汽车旅馆。

definition: to meet again after a long period of separation
to meet together/to assemble
to meet again/to be reunited/reunion
separated for a long time
to see each other/to meet in person
to meet (by chance)/to come across

person living or traveling far from home
to revisit old haunts (idiom); down memory lane
home/homeland/native place/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 恍如隔世[huang3 ru2 ge2 shi4]
to meet (in person)/to meet with sb
old friend
separated by a generation/a lifetime ago
like a thing of the previous generation/as if it were a lifetime ago
loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate
